title: List of prime ministers of India - Wikipedia
snippet: Earlier, Nehru had served as prime minister of the Interim Government of India during the British Raj from 2 September 1946 until 14 August 1947, his party, the Indian National Congress having won the 1946 Indian provincial elections. Nehru was succeeded by Lal Bahadur Shastri, whose 1 year 7-month term ended in his death in Tashkent, then in the USSR, where he had signed the Tashkent Declaration between India and Pakistan.

title: List of Prime Ministers of India | Britannica
snippet: India’s head of state is the president, whose powers are largely nominal and ceremonial. Effective executive power rests with the Council of Ministers, headed by the prime minister, who is chosen by the majority party or coalition in the Lok Sabha (lower house of parliament) and is formally appointed by the president. This is a chronologically ordered list of the prime ministers, from the earliest to the most recent.

title: PM Sangrahlaya - a Tribute to India's Prime Ministers
snippet: The Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya in New Delhi is a tribute by our nation to the Prime Ministers who rebuilt India after Independence
